00029 #ifndef _MUX_INP_BUF_H
00030 #define _MUX_INP_BUF_H
00031 
00032 #include "inxout.h"
00033 #include "queue.h"
00034 
00035 class   muxInpBuf: public inxout        {
00036 typedef inxout  baseclass;
00037 
00038 public:
00039                 muxInpBuf():    evtServ(this, keyEvtServ), evtStart(this, keyEvtStart)
00040                 {       sendingAllowed = ContSend;
00041                         serverState = serverIdling;
00042                         needToSchedule = TRUE;
00043                 }
00044         void    init();
00045         rec_typ REC(data *, int);
00046         void    early(event *);
00047         void    late(event *);
00048         int     command(char *, tok_typ *);
00049 
00050         int     export(exp_typ *);
00051 
00052         event   evtServ;
00053         event   evtStart;
00054 
00055         int     ninp;                   // # of inputs
00056 
00057         struct  inpStruct {
00058                 queue   q;              // a queue per input
00059                 int     bSize;          // buffer size, used for the byte-buffer version
00060                 int     bStart;         // buffer occupations where prec objects
00061                                         // may continue to send
00062                 rec_typ precState;      // states of preceeding objects
00063         }       *inpStructs;
00064 
00065         rec_typ sendingAllowed;         // are we allowed to send (if we wish so)?
00066         int     *candidates;            // inputs which have sth queued (used in late())
00067         data    *server;                // holds the data item in service
00068         int     needToSchedule;         // TRUE: late() isn't yet scheduled
00069         int     doStartStop;            // TRUE: use start-stop protocol on inputs
00070         tim_typ relaxTime;              // time steps to relax between two services
00071         tim_typ serviceTime;            // constant service time. if 0 then use serviceStepsPerByte
00072         double  serviceStepsPerByte;    // factor between data length in bytes and service time
00073         unsigned int    *lost;          // losses on inputs
00074         int             *qLen;          // queue occupation, coppied for easy export
00075 
00076         int     byteBuffer;             // TRUE: the buffer size counts in bytes
00077                                         // FALSE: buffer size counts in data objects
00078 
00079         int     *qLenBytes;
00080         unsigned int    *lostBytes;     // both used for the byte-buffer version
00081 
00082         int     pendingStartSignal;     // number of the input which to wake up next
00083 
00084         enum    {
00085                 serverIdling,
00086                 serverServing,
00087                 serverRelaxing,
00088                 serverStopped
00089         }       serverState;
00090 
00091         enum    {InpCtrl = -1};         // constant for control input
00092 
00093         enum    {keyEvtServ = 0, keyEvtStart = 1};
00094 };
00095 
00096 #endif  // _MUX_INP_BUF_H
